title: Coronavirus Anxiety Scale (CAS)
description: Assesses dysfunctional anxiety associated with the COVID-19 crisis through a brief 5-item self-report screening tool designed to identify individuals experiencing clinically significant coronavirus-related anxiety symptoms.

parameters.name: dizzy_news
parameters.description: I felt dizzy, lightheaded, or faint when I read or listened to news about the coronavirus
options: Rare, less than a day or two (1)
Nearly every day over the last 2 weeks (4)

parameters.name: sleep_problems
parameters.description: I had trouble falling or staying asleep because I was thinking about the coronavirus
options: Rare, less than a day or two (1)
Nearly every day over the last 2 weeks (4)

parameters.name: paralyzed_frozen
parameters.description: I felt paralyzed or frozen when I thought about or was exposed to information about the coronavirus
options: Rare, less than a day or two (1)
Nearly every day over the last 2 weeks (4)

parameters.name: appetite_loss
parameters.description: I lost interest in eating when I thought about or was exposed to information about the coronavirus
options: Rare, less than a day or two (1)
Nearly every day over the last 2 weeks (4)

parameters.name: nausea_stomach
parameters.description: I felt nauseous or had stomach problems when I thought about or was exposed to information about the coronavirus
options: Rare, less than a day or two (1)
Nearly every day over the last 2 weeks (4)

result.name: cas_score
result.description: Total CAS score indicating level of coronavirus-related anxiety

ranges.interpretation: Score below threshold for dysfunctional anxiety. Individual may experience normal concerns about COVID-19 but these do not significantly impair functioning or cause excessive distress.
Score indicates probable dysfunctional coronavirus-related anxiety that may significantly impair functioning. Clinical evaluation and potential intervention recommended.

references: Lee SA. Coronavirus Anxiety Scale: A brief mental health screener for COVID-19 related anxiety. Death Stud. 2020;44(7):393-401. doi: 10.1080/07481187.2020.1748481.

Lee SA, Jobe MC, Mathis AA, Gibbons JA. Incremental validity of coronaphobia: Coronavirus anxiety explains depression, generalized anxiety, and death anxiety. J Anxiety Disord. 2020;74:102263. doi: 10.1016/j.janxdis.2020.102263.
Lieven T, Kujath P, Araya M, et al. Global validation of the Coronavirus Anxiety Scale (CAS). Curr Psychol. 2021;1-8. doi: 10.1007/s12144-021-01837-w.
formula: Sum of all 5 item scores (0-4 each), with total range 0-20. Cut-off score ≥9 indicates dysfunctional anxiety (90% sensitivity, 85% specificity)
notes: Designed specifically for COVID-19 related anxiety, not general anxiety disorders
Cut-off score of ≥9 has 90% sensitivity and 85% specificity for dysfunctional anxiety
Time frame references the last 2 weeks for symptom assessment
Validated across multiple populations and demographic groups
Should be interpreted within broader clinical context and patient history
May be used as a screening tool but does not replace comprehensive mental health evaluation
